notes: Note: Russian artist, not Ukrainian. Member of The Wanderers 1889, Union of Russian Artists 1903. Taught at Moscow School of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture and Vkhutemas 1922-1924. People's Artist of USSR 1927. Known for peasant life themes, especially Russian women

Studied at Academy of Fine Arts in Bucharest, Romania (1938-1940). Solo exhibitions at National Museum of Fine Arts in Chisinau (1960, 1970, 1980). Solo exhibition at United Nations in Chisinau. Received Order of the Republic. Commemorative coin issued by Moldova in 2018 (centenary of birth). Exhibition in her honor at Moldova's National Museum of Art (2018). Moldovan expressionist painter.

Born in abandoned Tatar village before the revolution. Simple rural background. Lived through Soviet era experiencing hardships of different periods. Part of "Любимые художники Башкирии" (Beloved Artists of Bashkiria). Career spanned pre-revolutionary childhood through Soviet period to post-Soviet era.

Studied at Imperial Academy of Arts under F.A. Bruni (1852-1857). Title of Class Artist (1857), Academician of Painting (1860) for "Portrait of Mother". Moved to Kyiv (1863). Founded public drawing school at Kiev-Pechersk Lavra. Known for portraits and iconographic painting. Works in Russian State Hermitage, Dnipropetrovsk Museum, Kyiv Museum of Russian Art, Minsk Art Museum, Borodino Panorama Museum, Smolensk Museum, Roslavl Museum. Exhibited at Academic exhibitions (1860, 1869, 1887, 1889). Famous portraits: Princess M. Tenisheva, Professor Rakhmanov, Count Bobrinsky. Buried at Pokrovsky Monastery wall.

People's Artist of Russia. Won all-union contest as schoolchild, studied at Painting School for gifted children in Moscow. Studied at Repin Institute of Painting, Sculpture, and Architecture under B. Ioganson. Diploma work: "The Stakhanovist Workers at the Sevan Water Power Plant Construction" (1949). Joined Artists' Union 1949. Known for portraits, landscapes, and thematic pictures. Posthumous one-man show at Moscow Academy of Arts (2000). Works in State Tretyakov Gallery, State Russian Museum, Museum of Academy of Arts, Navy Museum St. Petersburg, and galleries in Tver, Smolensk.
Painter from Kherson, researched by Volodymyr Chupryna

Studied at Dnipropetrovsk Art College and Kyiv Art Institute. Mentors: K. Trokhimenko, I. Shtilman. Director of Dnipropetrovsk Art School (1955-1964). Head of Dnipropetrovsk Union of Artists (1958-1974). Secretary of the Board of Union of Artists Ukrainian SSR (1974-1981). Taught at Kyiv Art Institute (1975-1978). Honored Artist of Ukrainian SSR (1969). People's Artist of Ukrainian SSR (1976). Shevchenko State Prize Laureate (1978). Personal exhibitions: Dnipropetrovsk (1958, 1967, 1970), Kyiv (1960, 1970).

Graduated Krasnodar Art College 1933, Kiev Art Institute 1945 (workshop of A. Shovkunenko). Member Union of Artists Ukrainian SSR. WWII veteran, Order of Glory 3rd degree. Taught at Kiev Art Institute since 1952, professor since 1971. Honored Artist of USSR 1969. Specialized in Hutsul life themes, still life, landscape, portrait, genre paintings

Graduated Kyiv Art School 1913 as Artist First Degree. Teacher Kyiv Art School 1915-1925, professor Kyiv Art Institute until 1932, then Kharkiv Art Institute until 1941. Remained in Kharkiv during German occupation to preserve Institute. Persona non grata until rehabilitation 1973. Retrospective 1979

Graduate Berlin Academy of Art 1924. Worked Paris 1925-1936, recruited by GPU as Soviet agent 1933. Returned USSR 1936, moved Kyiv 1944. Winner Shevchenko National Prize 1972. People's Artist USSR 1985. Exhibited Berlin, Paris, Milan, Stockholm, Rome, London, Toronto. Most famous work: "Sinister Sea"
Polish nobility family, founder of Society of South Russian Artists 1889

Member USSR Academy of Arts 1947, founder industrial landscape

Studied with K.F. Bogaevsky and N. Barsamov. Member Union of Artists USSR 1953. Honored Artist Ukraine 1972, People's Artist Ukraine 1985. Gold medal "For Contribution to World Culture" 2010. Lives Yalta. Called "Soviet post-impressionist". Works in major Ukrainian museums
Teacher, known for portraits of children and youth

Studied Cracow Academy of Arts and Ukrainian Studio of Plastic Arts Prague. Settled Paris 1928. Associated with Durand-Ruel Gallery from 1943. Works in museums Paris, London, Stockholm, Lviv, Lucerne, Oxford University collection

Graduate physics/mathematics University of Kharkiv 1893. Studied Académie Julian Paris 1893-1896 under Jules Lefebvre and Tony Robert-Fleury. Student of Arkhyp Kuindzhi at Imperial Academy Saint Petersburg 1896. Specialized in landscapes with figures. Works in Kherson Regional Art Museum looted by Russia 2022

birth_place: Chornyi Ostriv, Galicia (now Lviv Oblast), Ukraine
notes: Graduate Lviv Institute of Applied and Decorative Art 1953 (studied under Roman Selsky, Yosyp Bokshai). Member Union of Artists USSR 1958. Honored Artist Ukraine 1996, People's Artist Ukraine 2006, Shevchenko National Prize 1999. Known for expressionist landscapes with brilliant colors. Prominent Lviv school painter
Worked at Gerasimov Institute of Cinematography. Known for film production design work

birth_place: Petrovka, Genichesky district, Kherson region, Ukraine
notes: Graduated Chisinau Republican Art College 1969, lives in Kherson since 1971
